p: By using different types of nanoparticles or multiple types of nanoparticles, we produced different kinds of metal oxide supraparticles for demonstration. Figure 4b–f is the SEM photographs of a large quantity of supraparticles generated by the self-assembly of TiO 2 nanoparticles (Fig. 4b), TiO 2 & SiO 2 nanoparticles (Fig. 4d), and TiO 2 & SiO 2 & Fe 3O 4 nanoparticles (Fig. 4f). Table 1 lists the composition of the ouzo solutions. Figure 4c displays the porous surface of the TiO 2 supraparticles. For the TiO 2 & SiO 2 supraparticles, the roughness difference is distinct at the top surface and the bottom surface (Fig. 4e). The calculated porosity is around 93%. Figure 4g, h is a sequence of zooms into the surface of the TiO 2 & SiO 2 & Fe 3O 4 supraparticle. The calculated porosity is around 91%. In Fig. 4h, different materials are distinguishable on the surface by virtue of an energy-selective backscatter detector (EsB): The bright spots pointed at by the yellow arrow are Fe 3O 4 nanoparticles; the light grey regions (the blue arrow) are TiO 2 nanoparticles; the dark grey regions (the red arrow) are SiO 2 nanoparticles. The darkness indicates holes on the surface.
